newsitem.title: DENMARK: Danish shares dip more than other European markets.
newsitem.headline: Danish shares dip more than other European markets.

text.p: Danish share prices declined more than most other European stock markets on Thursday afternoon after Novo Nordisk and bank paper falls.
"Major shares, notably Novo Nordisk and leading banks are behind the general fall, while most other European stock markets are the same or moving upwards," one dealer said.

Novo Nordisk was 21 crowns down at 1099, while Den Danske Bank and rival Unidanmark shed two crowns and one respectively to 436 and 290. The KFX top-20 index had lost 0.31 point to 130.65 at 1300 gmt, having closed 0.88 point lower on Wednesday. --Kenneth Lund Pedersen, Copenhagen newsroom, 45-33-969650
